pullRequest.body:
Self-contained PR filling an API gap for ENNReal. To be used in PR #9163.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks, and is labeled with `awaiting-review`.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

### PR summary [6163b9a5b6](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/14570/commits/6163b9a5b68ca7f7a1df07003aed7b7aa4d5efd1)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ eq_rpow_inv_iff`
`+ rpow_inv_eq_iff`
`++ le_rpow_inv_iff`
`++ lt_rpow_inv_iff`
`++ rpow_inv_le_iff`
`++ rpow_inv_lt_iff`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/no_lost_declarations.sh short <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/no_lost_declarations.sh <optional_commit>
```
</details>

</details>

Something funny might have happened with the 'awaiting-review' label. It wasn't available upon PR creation; then I wasn't sure whether creating or deleting it was the right thing to do. Sorry if I messed something up!

Per #announce on Zulip, the `awaiting-review` label is no more.

Also please follow the PR title convention (sorry can't link to it right now, but it is somewhere on the community website). Verbs should be in the present and every PR title should be of the form `type: Title` or `type(location): Title` where `type` is one of `feat`, `chore`, `refactor`, `fix`, `perf`, `doc`...

> It's really hard for me to check you haven't forgotten a lemma in the list (I am reviewing from a phone), so please carefully double-check you have got them all and tell me when you have done so. I will have to trust you.

I have double checked the added lemmas (both the titular one and the missing NNReal variants; this was non vacuous(!) because they had somehow gotten lost among the other edits). I have also checked that I've taken care of all instances of the deprecated pattern in Pow/NNReal.lean.

I imagine there are many more occurrences of the deprecated pattern throughout Mathlib, but chasing all of them down I think is beyond the scope of this PR.

Great, thanks!

maintainer merge

Build failed (retrying...):
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9891525699/job/27322140794)

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9892340931/job/27324771765)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9892340931/job/27324772527)

It's really hard for me to check you haven't forgotten a lemma in the list (I am reviewing from a phone), so please carefully double-check you have got them all and tell me when you have done so. I will have to trust you.

Thanks :tada:

bors merge

It's really hard for me to check you haven't forgotten a lemma in the list (I am reviewing from a phone), so please carefully double-check you have got them all and tell me when you have done so. I will have to trust you.

Thanks :tada:

bors merge

Can you check:
* `lt_rpow_inv` already exists for `ENNReal`. If not, add it.
* the corresponding lemmas for `Real` and `NNReal` exist. If not, add them.

* x ≤ y ^ z⁻¹ ↔ x ^ z ≤ y:
  - Real.le_rpow_inv_iff_of_pos
  - NNReal.le_rpow_one_div_iff
  - ENNReal.le_rpow_one_div_iff
* x ^ z⁻¹ ≤ y ↔ x ≤ y ^ z:
  - Real.rpow_inv_le_iff_of_pos
  - NNReal.rpow_one_div_le_iff
  - ENNReal.rpow_one_div_le_iff
* x < y ^ z⁻¹ ↔ x ^ z < y :
  - Real.lt_rpow_inv_iff_of_pos
  - NNReal <- missing
  - ENNReal.lt_rpow_one_div_iff
* x ^ z⁻¹ < y ↔ x < y ^ z:
  - Real.rpow_inv_lt_iff_of_pos
  - NNReal <- missing
  - ENNReal <- this PR

The NNReal and ENNReal modules use `1 / z` instead of `z⁻¹`. I will add the missing theorems, but I won't change the existing API, unless it is deemed the right time to do so.
We are trying to phase out `1 / z`, so yes please add the `z^-1` versions and deprecate the `1 / z` ones

```suggestion
@[deprecated (since := "2024-07-10") le_rpow_inv_iff]
```
so that users know which lemma to switch to

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(ENNReal): `ENNReal.rpow_inv_lt_iff`
